questions.title: Two Sum (Explain Only)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find two numbers in a transaction list that add up to a specific target amount.
followups: Would you check all pairs or remember past numbers?
How would you handle duplicate transaction amounts?
What is the time complexity trade-off between the two approaches?

questions.title: Reverse a String (Steps)
questions.prompt: Explain step-by-step how you would reverse a string like 'JPMORGAN'.
followups: Where do you start and stop?
How do you verify the result without using built-in reverse functions?
How would you do this in-place to save memory?

questions.title: Palindrome Check
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if a transaction ID reads the same forwards and backwards.
followups: Would case sensitivity matter for alphanumeric IDs?
Why is comparing from both ends efficient?
What edge case would you test first?

questions.title: Find the Largest Number
questions.prompt: Explain how you would find the largest transaction amount in a daily ledger list.
followups: How do you track the current maximum?
What if the list is empty or contains negative amounts?
Why is this approach considered O(n)?

questions.title: Counting Items (Frequency Map)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would count how many times each stock ticker appears in a list of executed trades.
followups: What is the key and value in your data structure?
Why is a hash map better than counting manually with nested loops?
How would you handle millions of trades per second?

questions.title: Remove Duplicates (Conceptual)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would remove duplicate account IDs from a list for a batch statement process.
followups: How do you detect duplicates?
Does the order of the original list need to be preserved?
What is the time complexity difference between using a Set and comparing each pair?

questions.title: Binary Search (Idea Only)
questions.prompt: Explain how you could search for a specific interest rate in a sorted list of bond yields faster than checking every item.
followups: Why does the list need to be sorted?
What does 'cutting the search space in half' mean?
Give a real-life example of using this at a bank.

questions.title: Merge Two Sorted Lists
questions.prompt: Explain how you would merge two sorted lists of transaction timestamps into one sorted list.
followups: What do you compare first?
What happens when one list finishes before the other?
How would you handle millisecond precision in timestamps?

questions.title: Valid Parentheses (Idea Level)
questions.prompt: Explain how you would check if brackets in a complex financial formula string are correctly matched.
followups: Why does the order of closing brackets matter?
What makes a string invalid?
Give an example of a valid nested structure.

questions.title: FizzBuzz (Reasoning)
questions.prompt: Explain the rules of FizzBuzz. Why is this question still relevant in interviews?
followups: What common mistakes do candidates make?
How do you keep the code readable and maintainable?
How would you extend this to print 'JPM' for multiples of 7?

questions.title: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) Basics
questions.prompt: Explain the four main principles of Object-OOriented Programming.
followups: What is the difference between a Class and an Object?
Give a banking-related example of Encapsulation (e.g., Account class).
Why is Polymorphism useful in large enterprise applications?

questions.title: Array vs Linked List
questions.prompt: Explain the primary difference between an Array and a Linked List.
followups: Which one is better for random access?
Which one is more memory efficient for inserting in the middle?
Why would JPMC choose one over the other for a real-time trading log?

questions.title: Stack vs Queue
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between a Stack and a Queue. Give a financial example of each.
followups: What does LIFO and FIFO mean?
Where would a Stack be used in an undo feature for a trading application?
Where would a Queue be used for processing loan applications?

questions.title: Big-O (Plain English)
questions.prompt: In simple terms, what does Big-O notation help a developer understand?
followups: Why does performance matter when processing 1 million transactions?
Is the fastest algorithm always the best choice?
When is a simple O(nÂ²) solution acceptable?

questions.title: HashMap Internals (High Level)
questions.prompt: Explain how a HashMap works internally at a high level.
followups: What is a hash code?
How are collisions handled?
What is the time complexity of get() and put() in ideal vs worst case?

questions.title: REST API Basics
questions.prompt: Explain what a REST API is using a simple banking example (e.g., retrieving an account balance).
followups: What does the GET method do?
What is the difference between POST and PUT?
What HTTP status code would you return for 'Account Not Found'?

questions.title: HTTP vs HTTPS
questions.prompt: What is the main difference between HTTP and HTTPS and why is it critical for JPMC?
followups: What does the 'S' stand for?
How does encryption protect customer data?
What is an SSL/TLS certificate?

questions.title: Database Index Basics
questions.prompt: What is a database index and why is it used?
followups: What are the trade-offs of adding too many indexes?
If a query is slow, is adding an index always the answer?
What columns would you index in an 'Accounts' table?

questions.title: SQL: Basic Join
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between INNER JOIN and LEFT JOIN using Customers and Accounts tables.
followups: What happens to the columns from the right table if there is no match in a LEFT JOIN?
Can you join a table to itself?
How would you find customers who have no accounts?

questions.title: Debugging Basics
questions.prompt: Your Java service is throwing a NullPointerException. What are the first steps you take to debug it?
followups: How do you locate the exact line of code?
What tools do you use (IDE debugger, logs)?
How do you prevent this from happening again?

questions.title: Version Control (Git) Basics
questions.prompt: Why is version control important when working on a team of 20 developers at JPMC?
followups: What is a commit?
What is the purpose of branching?
How do you resolve a simple merge conflict?

questions.title: Why JPMorgan Chase? (Intern Focus)
questions.prompt: Why do you want to intern at JPMorgan Chase specifically?
followups: What do you know about the 'Code for Good' hackathon?
How does JPMC's focus on technology in finance appeal to you?
What specific skills do you hope to learn in a financial services environment?

questions.title: Behavioral: Learning from Mistakes
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you made a mistake in a coding project. How did you fix it and what did you learn?
followups: How did you discover the mistake?
What was the impact of the mistake?
What process did you put in place to prevent it from happening again?

questions.title: Behavioral: Teamwork
questions.prompt: Describe a time you worked in a team to achieve a difficult goal.
followups: What was your specific role?
How did you handle disagreements?
What was the outcome?
